attributes.action: Open gyms permanently through out coronavirus lockdown periods
attributes.additional_details:
Gyms help lots of people with their physical health alongside their mental health. 

There will be individuals that now exercise after work in the dark and cold on their own leaving them more vulnerable to harm in their local areas. The gym is a safe environment not just because it’s supervised but because they have spent millions on rebuilding gyms to allow them to be covid secure. 

Gyms also help with immune systems by making them stronger. They help with physical and mental health.
attributes.background:
Gyms to be open for mental and physical health. 

Gyms are not just used to get fit, they are used to help individuals with their mental health such as eating disorders and stress. They are also used for Physical health such as people in the community who have disabilities.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
